page.title: 09HAUGHLEY PARK
page.content: Mr. Williams owns the Park. There are 150 acres grassland, and 60 acres woodland. There are coniferous and deciduous trees, some young and some ancient. One oak is over 30 feet round and is 1,000 years old, another is 22 feet round, 60 years old. There are 600 sheep, part Suffolk breed. The park is regularly open to the public. Guides and Scouts camp there. People from all over the world visit the park. A Visit to Haughley Park. We went to Haughley Park, we climbed on the logs and made a see-saw and a cap in a log pile. I liked playing on the logs best. In the woods we saw bluebells, we went right through the woods. There are nesting boxes for the birds. We saw sheep on the meadows, when they saw us they ran away.
